meta.group_description: Management of your personal API keys in the pool.

add.description: Add an API key to the pool.

params.api_key: The OpenAI API key to add to the shared pool.

remove.description: Remove an API key from the pool.

params.api_key: The OpenAI API key to remove from the shared pool.

clear.description: Clear all your API keys from the pool.

list.description: List all API keys in your pool (encrypted).

explanation.body:
**What is the API Pool?**
The API Pool is a secure and anonymous collection of shared OpenAI API keys. It enables Moderator Bot to continue operating effectively, even when individual users face rate limits.

**How does it work?**
- When you add your OpenAI API key to the pool, it's encrypted and stored securely.
- The bot uses these keys exclusively for accessing OpenAI models to perform moderation tasks.
- Your API key remains confidential; no one, including the bot developers, can view it.
- You have full control and can remove your API key from the pool at any time.

**Important:** To contribute your API key, your OpenAI account must have at least $5 in prepaid credits. Even though the moderation endpoint is free to use, OpenAI requires accounts to have active billing details and quota. You can add credit to your account here: <https://platform.openai.com/account/billing/overview>

By contributing your API key, you help ensure that Moderator Bot remains responsive and effective for all users.

add.duplicate: This API key already exists in the pool.
add.success: API key added to the pool.

remove.success: API key removed from your pool.
remove.missing: This API key was not found in your pool. Use /api_pool list to see your current API keys.

clear.success: All API keys have been cleared from your pool.
clear.empty: No API keys found to clear.

list.empty: No API keys found in your pool.

api_pool.disabled: ⚠️ The API pool is disabled because this bot isn't configured with the FERNET_SECRET_KEY environment variable. Set it to manage shared OpenAI API keys.
